Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2008 03:24PM kiechr wrote: Hi: I just had a excisional biopsy done 1-week ago.  My lump was on the side and was movable.  My scar is approx 2 inches and I had no pain at all after.  What I did find was that my breast was tender and bruised and definately wear a bra or a tank top with built in support.  I'm a 34a and even though I'm small, I quickly found out that support definately helps.  For me it was the anestetic that seemed to take its toll on me.  About 2 - 3 days after I was very nausious and light headed, so if this happs take it easy.  I removed the steri strips after 5 days and the incision is healing nicely, no indentation left.  I guess the main thing to remember is that an indentation is a small price to pay if the results come back as benign.  Good Luck and take care, I too am going through a divorce so for me everything is on hold until I get a clear bill of health.  Take care of yourself first and somehow we will get through this and come out stronger on the other end!
